data.name: Coffee
data.description: Fred owns a coffee shop. He needs to make a program to make the coffee shop run. And he dumps it on you. Again. # Notes # For your order function, you will get something that looks like this: ``` python [[20, "L"], [16, "M"]] ``` And will return this: ``` python [20, "L", 16, "M"] ``` ## Explanation ## The list is the order. Each element contains the amount of coffee ordered in fluid ounces at index 0, and the size of the croissant at index 1. ``` python "L"=3 "M"=2 "S"=1 ``` Amounts listed in dollars The calculate function will take output from your order function, and then give the price. Coffee is 3/8 of a dollar per oz. # NOTE # I AM WORKING ON THE SAMPLE TEST IT MIGHT TAKE A COUPLE OF DAYS
